description.value:
Beginning at 1st level, you can call on your bond with nature to mark a creature as your quarry for a time: you know the hunter's mark spell, and Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it. Moreover, you do not have to concentrate on the hunter's mark once you cast it; it lasts for its full duration, until you end it as a bonus action, or until you are incapacitated.

You can use this a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once) without expending a spell slot. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

When you gain the Spellcasting feature at 2nd level, hunter's mark does not count against the number of ranger spells you can prepare.

Starting at 13th level in ranger, any attacks you make against your hunter's mark target score a critical on a 19 or 20.

Starting at 17th level in ranger, any time you roll the maximum hunter's mark damage, you can roll one more hunter's mark die and add it to the total.
